TEXT.TITLE: GM <GM> CLOSING TWO PLANTS TEMPORARILY
TEXT.BODY: General Motors Corp said it is closing two plants for brief periods in March, placing 5,500 on temporary layoff for up to two weeks. The company said its Hamtramck Buick-Oldsmobile-Cadillac assembly plant in Detroit will be down from March 9 to March 16 due to excess inventory of several models, placing 2,000 workers on temporary layoff. Its Chevrolet-Pontiac-GM of Canada assembly facility in Norwood, Ohio, will be closed two weeks from March 9 to 23 due to material shortages, affecting 3,500. There is no change in the 37,000 hourly workers out of work indefinitely. Reuter
